p: We measured physiological variables at half‐hour intervals starting from 08:00 to 14:00. We recorded rectal temperature (RT, °C.) with a digital clinical thermometer. We counted flank movements for 1 min with the help of a stopwatch and recorded respiration rate (RR, breaths/min). The heat tolerance coefficient (HTC, expressed as arbitrary unit) was derived from physiological measurements, HTC = RR/23 + RT/38.3 (Bianca, 1963). Pulse rate (PR, beats/min) was recorded for 1 min using a stethoscope. Starting from 08:00, 5 ml of blood was collected at 2‐hr intervals via the jugular venous puncture in the vacutainer with 5 mg EDTA as the anticoagulant, under aseptic conditions for hematological and genetic analysis. Blood samples (5 ml) without EDTA were also collected, centrifuged at 450 × g for 10 min, and stored at −20°C for determination of serum cortisol concentration using an enzyme immunoassay kit (EIA steroid cortisol kit, Agappe Diagnostics Limited, India).
